title: Quiz 6: January 2013 Licensure Exam
description: Complete licensure examination covering Community Health, Management, Education, and Mental Health from January 2013. Contains all MCQs, Short Answer, and Essay concepts.

questions.question: Paranoid personality disorder is usually characterized by:

options.text: Social anxiety, inability to make close friendship
Self dramatization, inability to make close friendship

questions.explanation: Paranoid personality disorder is characterized by a pervasive distrust and suspiciousness of others, often accompanied by hypersensitivity to criticism.

questions.question: When developing educational objectives, the cognitive domain should focus on:
questions.explanation: The cognitive domain (Bloom's) deals with mental skills: knowledge, comprehension, concepts, and facts.

questions.question: Transformational leadership aims at:

options.text: Maintaining equilibrium or the status quo
Inspiring others to achieve the organizational vision
Performing tasks at ones best to improve efficiency

questions.explanation: Transformational leaders inspire and motivate followers to exceed expectations and achieve a shared vision.

questions.question: A null hypothesis:

options.text: Always states that a real relationship exists between two variables
Always states that no real relationship exists between two variables
Is suitable where previous findings conflict
Specifies the nature of the relationship between unknown variables

questions.explanation: The null hypothesis (H0) assumes there is no significant difference or relationship between variables.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of the grieving process (Elizabeth Kubler-Ross) in the correct order:
questions.explanation: The stages are DABDA: Denial, Anger, Bargaining, Depression, Acceptance.

questions.question: The purpose of organizing in management is to:

options.text: Assign duties and co-ordinate the efforts of individuals
Spread responsibilities for final results to the top management
Distribute the human resource equally in the organization
Ensure that work is organized at all levels to ensure control

questions.explanation: Organizing involves structuring resources and assigning tasks/duties to coordinate efforts toward goals.
questions.hint: Putting people and tasks in order.

questions.question: In teaching, the skill of stimulus variation is achieved by:

options.text: Use of gestures, variation of speech pattern
Use of gestures, avoiding negative expression

questions.explanation: Stimulus variation keeps students attentive by changing how information is presented (movement, voice changes, gestures).

questions.question: The autonomic nervous system side effects of tricyclic anti-depressant drugs are:

options.text: Muscle twitching, fine tremor, peripheral neuropathy
Constipation, increased sweating, difficulty in micturition

questions.explanation: TCAs have anticholinergic effects: dry mouth, constipation, urinary retention, and blurred vision.

questions.question: Capital budgets in an organization:

options.text: Consist of salary and personnel expenditure
Represents income expected for the budget period
Is the statement of expected revenue for a period of one year
Aims at meeting the term goals of an organization

questions.explanation: Capital budgets cover long-term investments (equipment, buildings) that meet long-term organizational goals.

questions.question: In total quality management, benchmarking refers to:

options.text: Measurement of the organization performance against the best in the industry
Quest for excellence in creating the best services
Maintaining excellence to maintain competitive advantage
Measurement of performance against set standard

questions.explanation: Benchmarking is comparing your processes and performance metrics to the industry bests.

questions.question: A disadvantage of simulation as an instructional method involves:

options.text: Allows the student to make their first serious mistake safely
Simulation techniques cannot model all dimensions of a real situation
There is a link between training and real situations

questions.explanation: Simulation is limited by its inability to fully replicate the complexity of real life.

questions.question: The accuracy and consistency of measurement, giving essentially the same results under similar conditions is:
questions.explanation: Reliability = Consistency. Validity = Accuracy/Truth.
questions.hint: Can you rely on it to be the same every time?

questions.question: Anti-anxiety medication produces a calming effect by:

options.text: Depressing the sub-cortical levels of the central nervous system

questions.explanation: Anxiolytics (benzodiazepines) depress the CNS, specifically acting on the limbic system (sub-cortical) via GABA.

questions.question: A sample error can be defined as:

options.text: Any statistic data computed on a sample
The discrepancy between the characteristics of the population and the sample

questions.explanation: Sampling error is the difference between the sample result and the true population value due to chance.
questions.hint: The difference between the part and the whole.

questions.question: One of McGregor's Theory X assumptions states that:

options.text: An average person can learn responsibility
Human beings want to avoid responsibility and need to be directed
Human beings like to exercise control of their work
The ability to make innovation is widely spread

questions.explanation: Theory X assumes employees are lazy, dislike work, and avoid responsibility. Theory Y assumes the opposite.

questions.question: In conflict resolution, accommodation refers to:

options.text: A strategy where both parties work to achieve satisfaction
A strategy where individuals neglect their own concerns in favor of the other person's concern
A strategy where either party fails to confront the issue
A strategy where both parties take a middle position

questions.explanation: Accommodation involves yielding to the other party, sacrificing one's own needs to maintain peace.

questions.question: The measures of variability as used in descriptive statistics are:
questions.explanation: Variability (dispersion) is measured by Range, Variance, and Standard Deviation. Mean/Mode/Median are central tendency.
questions.hint: How spread out is the data?

questions.question: The symptoms of catatonic schizophrenia include:
questions.explanation: Catatonia is characterized by motor immobility (waxy flexibility), mutism, and extreme negativism.

questions.question: In a research problem statement:

options.text: Clearly indicates the researcher anticipated explanation
Focuses on the phenomenon that the researcher desires to describe, predict, control or explain
Provides the basis for establishing hypothesis

questions.explanation: The problem statement defines the specific issue or phenomenon the research aims to address.

questions.question: In an organization, policies are:

options.text: Step by step ways of carrying out processes

questions.explanation: Policies are general guidelines or decision-making guides. Procedures are step-by-step methods.

questions.question: Select the barriers to disease control programs in the community:
questions.explanation: Barriers include financial constraints, cultural resistance, logistical issues, and lack of education.
questions.hint: What stops a program from working?

questions.question: What are the specific functions of School Health Services?
questions.explanation: Functions include screening, disease control, education, environment monitoring, and first aid.
questions.hint: Primary care in a school setting.

questions.question: Identify the principles of Community Health Nursing:

options.text: Focus on the community as the unit of care
Work in partnership with the community

questions.explanation: CHN principles emphasize the community as the client, prevention, partnership, and equitable distribution of resources.

questions.question: Select the types of low-dose oral contraceptive pills:
questions.explanation: Low dose pills include Monophasic COCs, Multiphasic COCs, and POPs.

questions.question: What are the clinical manifestations of Yellow Fever?
questions.explanation: Key signs: Fever, Jaundice (Yellow), and Hemorrhage (Fever).
questions.hint: It's called Yellow Fever for a reason.

questions.question: Select the prevention and control measures for Yellow Fever:
questions.explanation: Prevention relies on Vaccination (most effective) and Vector control (Aedes mosquito). It is viral, so antibiotics don't work.
questions.hint: Kill the mosquito, take the shot.
